repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
add border in completion window. config it by using `completepopup` option. 
option in picture is `set completepopup=border:rounded,title:Omnifunc,title_pos:center`

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/41671631/14b66768-46ab-421c-904a-206cfa578dd0)




Fix #15551

comment_data.body: if possible we should reuse most of `win_redr_border` . It is only called in one place, so the window specific parts could be moved out and instead have something like `grid_draw_border` which takes `grid` and inner height/width as parameters.

## Call to function with fewer arguments than declared parameters

This call has fewer arguments than required by [parse_completepopup](1).

[Show more details](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/security/code-scanning/49)

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1515,6 +1515,20 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 		    select one from the menu. Only works in combination with
 		    "menu" or "menuone".
 
+						*'completepopup'* *'cpp'*
+'completepopup' 'cpp'	string	(default "")
+			global
+		This option is used to set the completion window and info floating
+		preview window. The option is a comma-separated list of values:
+		`align`, `border`, `title`, `title_pos`, `footer`, `footer_pos`.
+		see |nvim_open_win|.

@@ -1515,6 +1515,20 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 		    select one from the menu. Only works in combination with
 		    "menu" or "menuone".

+'completepopup' 'cpp'	string	(default "")
+			global
+		This option is used to set the completion window and info floating
+		preview window. The option is a comma-separated list of values:
+		`align`, `border`, `title`, `title_pos`, `footer`, `footer_pos`.
+		see |nvim_open_win|.

 		    select one from the menu. Only works in combination with
 		    "menu" or "menuone".
 
+						*'completepopup'* *'cpp'*
+'completepopup' 'cpp'	string	(default "")
+			global
+		This option is used to set the completion window and info floating
+		preview window. The option is a comma-separated list of values:
+		`align`, `border`, `title`, `title_pos`, `footer`, `footer_pos`.
+		see |nvim_open_win|.

comment_data.body: A bit of a nit, but for most other options (like 'completeopt') we don't use underscores, so I think this should be `titlepos` (and similarly for `footerpos`).
Please mention about the default `align` value. I guess it is ~`item`~ `menu`.

       type = 'string',
       varname = 'p_cot',
     },

comment_regular_data.body:
mostly finished. confused on the format of custom border characters..does this is valid ? afaik vim options do not have this way of use array nested.

```
set completepopup=border:[ ["+", "MyBorder"], ["-", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["|", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["-", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["|", "MyBorder"] ]
```

Is it necessary to add different borders for pum and info like add `pum_border` and `info_border` . if border set then pum and info both use `border` otherwise pum use `pum_border` info use `info_border`. :thinking:

@glepnir, if I understand correctly, `title` and `footer` in the suggested 'completepopup' design set an actual title string shown in the window. How is it intended to actually be used? In particular:
- Is title used by default with the built-in completion sources (like omnifunc, paths, lines, etc.)? Because if not and users have to set it manually (like `title:Omnifunc` in the original comment), then a) how are they supposed to *set* it (via remapping all `<C-x>...` mappings, or something else?); and b) how are they supposed to *unset* it (so that mismatched title is not shown with different source)?
- Built-in completion can also be triggered via `complete()`. Is the intended way of utilizing title by updating 'completepopup' option? If so, then what is the intended way to unset it later?

Maybe it would be better to have 'title' and 'footer' be boolean to represent whether a (some dedicated) title should be shown if there is a border? This way built-in sources can provide their own titles while `complete()` would require a third `opts` argument (if possible).

1. Currently there is no matching default completion mode.  can be added. if has border and is default completion mode 
    set defualt title lik path keyword etc.
3. Keep the original value before complete and restore it in ondone ? maybe

> * Currently there is no matching default completion mode.  can be added. if has border and is default completion mode
>   set defualt title lik path keyword etc.

To me this sounds cleaner from the user's view. At the same time this makes string 'title' and 'footer' values somewhat questionable.

> * Keep the original value before complete and restore it in ondone ? maybe

Sure, yet this sounds somewhat complicated.

I think that actual string values of title and footer are more "temporary" data that actually describes the *source* of completion and not the completion popup as a whole. So maybe it is better to somehow be a part of completion source definition? And instead use something like boolean `showtitle` and `showfooter` which would define whether a user *wants* title and footer to be shown?
I will add the default completion mode title support first and then think about the second question more carefully

> mostly finished. confused on the format of custom border characters..does this is valid ? afaik vim options do not have this way of use array nested.
> 
> ```
> set completepopup=border:[ ["+", "MyBorder"], ["-", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["|", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["-", "MyBorder"], ["+", "MyBorder"], ["|", "MyBorder"] ]
> ```

I was just trying this out, and was wondering if this was implemented yet in some way? I couldn't manage to make a custom border work. If not implemented yet, sorry for commenting
There are plans to implement this form of support in option . But it's not here :) currently just some string value which defined in nvim_open_win
Is it possible and related to this PR to enable separate settings for cmdline and Insert mode menu?
yes.  just check `State == MODE_CMDLINE` to detect in cmdline ..  When in cmdline it should be called something with wild prefix.. like `wildpopup` ?

> yes. just check `State == MODE_CMDLINE` to detect in cmdline .. When in cmdline it should be called something with wild prefix.. like `wildpopup` ?

It would be nice to have it almost here. IIRC `vim.ui_attach(ns, {ext_popupmenu = true},` didn't allow such separation (to, for example, touch only insert mode menu).
get mode in callback of ui_attach does not make sense ?

It's not clear for me (and documented in `:h vim.ui_attach()`, along with its example) what to do in the callback `if vim.fn.mode() == 'c'` to keep only cmdline menu untouched. 

Please possibly mark it as offtopic. 

edit: `vim.ui_detach()` on `CmdlineEnter` seems to be known workaround.

title: feat(completion): add border and completepopup option
